metadata.title: CVE-2022-45141 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Since the Windows Kerberos RC4-HMAC Elevation of Privilege Vulnerabilitywas disclosed by Microsoft on Nov 8 2022 and per RFC8429 it is assumed thatrc4-hmac is weak, Vulnerable Samba Active Directory DCs will issue rc4-hmacencrypted tickets despite the target server supporting better encryption(eg aes256-cts-hmac-sha1-96).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libnss-winbind - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libpam-winbind - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libsmbclient - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libwbclient0 - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
python3-samba - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
registry-tools - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-ad-dc - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-ad-provision - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-common - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-common-bin - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-libs - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-testsuite - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
smbclient - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
winbind - 2:4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
ldb-tools - 2:2.7.2+samba4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libldb2 - 2:2.7.2+samba4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
python3-ldb - 2:2.7.2+samba4.18.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2').
